channel.title: Question>>
channel.description: How could i get a desent education on coding, ive read books but they really dont help much? Preferably so i could code rsps's please post your opinions.

item.title: Question>>
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“tupperlake67, post:9, topic:425132”]yep im trying hands on activities, but its not working really well every time i get something wrong…

And lol i dont know any dutch guy’s[/quote]

A huge portion of my server’s playerbase are Dutch. I’d say about 20%. They’re huge in the private server community at least.

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:15, topic:425132”]Whats on TV isn’t as important as the fact that TV is on.

Your problem is not that you are not understanding and not attempting at the programming language. One can read a book, tutorial or watch a video on the subject but when it comes down to it… practice practice practice. My mistake when I first started was I read books. What I really should of done was fool around with things in eclipse. It is one thing to understand (as anybody can) but its another thing to actually get it done.[/quote]

I prefer books rather than online tutorials.

But yes, practice is golden.

Read full topic

item.title: Question>>
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Whats on TV isn’t as important as the fact that TV is on.

Your problem is not that you are not understanding and not attempting at the programming language. One can read a book, tutorial or watch a video on the subject but when it comes down to it… practice practice practice. My mistake when I first started was I read books. What I really should of done was fool around with things in eclipse. It is one thing to understand (as anybody can) but its another thing to actually get it done.

Read full topic

item.title: Question>>
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

tupperlake67:

books are too general… What is a good book?? that explains alot

It depends what you want to do. I’m personally not a good book learner. I get through my books for classes, but that’s about it. Learning programming for me is a hands-on activity. I look through other people’s code, experiment with my own, or look up solutions. I like trying to infer how code works and why certain code was used over others, rather than having it explained to me.

I only say this because you may be similar. If books aren’t appealing for you, try a hands-on approach instead.

Read full topic

item.title: Question>>
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

if you want an education in programming your should want it for a career if thats truly what you want, not b/c you want to program rsps. I went to college which seems like a what of money. i didn’t even learn how to use google better even though we used it for almost everything. we were expected to read(I cant remember anything I read from textbooks) the chapters in our text books but we hardly did. we didn’t even cover all the stuff I already knew in java. so java-wise i haven’t learn anything more than I learned b4 college but vb and c# I did. So i say find a highly rated textbook buy it, and read it, b/c that all you will be doing in college. and if you really need help understanding something im sure someone would help.

plus this should probably be in general questions since this isnt about programming code.

Read full topic
